REVIEW: Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in New York City. The Combo Lo Mein was a bland, uninspiring take on a classic dish, lacking the vibrant flavors one would expect from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, while adequately warm, was nothing more than a forgettable sidekick to an already underwhelming meal. To top it off, the Ice Tea was watered down, failing to provide a refreshing balance to the meal. Overall, Peking Truck failed to deliver the authentic and satisfying experience I was hoping for.

The Nani's Kitchen delivery was a delight. The tandoori mixed grill was perfectly marinated and cooked, with tender chicken and flavorful vegetables. The lean chicken tikka masala was also a hit, with tender chicken and a rich, creamy sauce. The combination curry was a generous portion and included a variety of flavorful vegetables and meat. Overall, the food was delicious and the delivery was prompt and efficient. I would highly recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone looking for a flavorful Indian meal.

Mac Shack failed to impress with its subpar dining experience. Their Standard Mac & Cheese fell flat on flavor and was overcooked. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was smothered in an excessively spicy sauce, overwhelming the dish. Most disappointing was the Lobster Mac & Cheese, anticipated to be the highlight, but it was a disappointment with scarcely any lobster present. Overall, the food quality was below par and not worthy of recommendation for anyone in search of a fulfilling Mac & Cheese experience in Cape Town.

Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings were a letdown. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked flavor and any semblance of cheesiness. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese provided a slight spicy kick, but the cheese remained disappointingly lacking in creaminess and richness. The Lobster Mac & Cheese, despite its promise of "lobster tails in a dream," proved to be a misnomer. The lobster flavor was faint and the lobster itself was scarce. At least the bottled water was chilled and refreshing, providing a brief respite from the unremarkable mac and cheese. In conclusion, The Mac Shack is not a recommended destination for those seeking a fulfilling mac and cheese experience.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Montreal delivered a mixed experience with our poutine order. The Classic, a traditional poutine, was well-executed with perfectly crispy fries, squeaky cheese curds, and a rich, savory gravy. The Kitchen Sink, however, was a bit overwhelmed by its numerous toppings, which muddled the overall taste. The Mother's Favorite had a unique twist with its chicken and BBQ sauce, but it could have benefited from a stronger flavor profile. The Ice Tea was refreshing, providing a nice balance to the rich poutine dishes. Overall, there were both highs and lows, making this food truck a decent, but not exceptional, choice for poutine in Montreal.

The King Combo and Gyro Plate were bland and uninspired, the Greek salad was limp and wilted, and the bottled water and soda were overpriced. The service was friendly, but the food simply didn't live up to expectations. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a quick and satisfying Greek feast.

"Vorrei esprimere la mia profonda delusione riguardo al mio recente ordine di poutine da Revenge of the Curds a Londra. Ho ordinato The Classic, Mother's Favorite, The Kitchen Sink e bevande come bibita in bottiglia e tè freddo. Purtroppo, sono rimasto molto insoddisfatto del cibo che ho ricevuto.La poutine era unta e gommosa, con formaggio a brandelli e salsa insipida. In particolare, The Kitchen Sink era una delusione, poiché mi aspettavo una varietà di ingredienti freschi e gustosi, ma invece ho trovato solo ingredienti scadenti e di bassa qualità.Anche le bevande erano deludenti, poiché la bibita in bottiglia era stanza e il tè freddo era acquoso e privo di sapore. In generale, il servizio e la qualità del cibo di Revenge of the Curds a Londra non sono all'altezza delle mie aspettative e non raccomanderei questo ristorante a nessuno."

The Cheeky Greek truck in Barcelona is a culinary gem! Their Gyros menu is a delightful fusion of authentic Greek flavors and contemporary street food style. The Greek Salad was fresh, crisp, and bursting with flavor. The Gyro Plate, a classic favorite, was perfectly cooked and seasoned, offering a scrumptious bite every time. But the star of the show was The King Combo, a generous serving of succulent meats and tangy sauces, all wrapped up in a warm pita. Paired with refreshing Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Bottled Water, it was a meal fit for royalty. This food truck is a must-visit for anyone seeking a delicious, filling, and authentic Greek experience in Barcelona.

"Peking Truck in Berlin serves up a delightful Wonton Soup that is a true delight for the senses. The wontons were perfectly cooked, with just the right amount of filling, and the broth was rich and flavorful. The Chinese menu offered a variety of options, but the Wonton Soup was the standout star. The truck's atmosphere was cozy and inviting, making for a pleasant dining experience. If you're in Berlin and craving Chinese cuisine, Peking Truck is a must-visit. The Wonton Soup alone is worth the trip!"

The Tasty Tibs truck in Sydney failed to deliver on the promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Beef Tibs were disappointingly dry and lacked the rich, spicy flavor I was expecting. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and uninspiring. The portions were also smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Overall, this food truck did not live up to my expectations and I would not recommend it to others seeking a true Ethiopian culinary experience.

The Mega Melt lived up to its name, crafting a grilled cheese masterpiece that had me drooling. The crispy bread, melted cheese, and perfectly balanced fillings of The Original and The Ranch were heavenly. The bottled water and soda were refreshing and perfectly paired with the food. The Miss Piggie was a delightful side dish, adding a touch of sweetness to the meal. The atmosphere in Tokyo was buzzing, and the service was friendly and efficient. Overall, a perfect indulgence for a hungry traveler.

The Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crêpes was an absolute delight! The delicate, perfectly cooked crepe was filled with a zesty, sweet orange butter that was simply divine. The flavor was well-balanced, and the presentation was top-notch. It was a true taste of France in the heart of Cape Town. I highly recommend this dish to anyone looking for a delicious, authentic crepe experience. Le Coin des Crêpes has certainly set the bar high!

The Plant Palace truck's "The Salad of All Salads" and "Veggie Burger" offering in Vancouver was a delightful experience. The salad was fresh and vibrant, with a variety of textures and flavors that harmonized perfectly. The veggie burger was equally impressive, with a juicy patty and flavorful toppings that complemented the crispy exterior. The overall presentation and friendly service were commendable. While the price point may be slightly higher than some competitors, the quality of ingredients and the generous portions make it a worthwhile investment.

The Peking Truck in Cape Town is a culinary delight! The Chinese menu offers a variety of delicious options, but the standout for me was the Combo Fried Rice and Wonton Soup. Fried rice was flavorful, with each grain perfectly cooked, and the vegetables added a delightful crunch. The Wonton Soup was a comforting bowl of goodness, with the wontons themselves being a highlight, stuffed with a savory filling. The beverages, Bottled Water, Bottled Soda, and Ice Tea, were a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. The Peking Truck is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic Chinese cuisine in Cape Town.

The Smoky BBQ truck in London exceeded expectations with their Spring Mix Salad. The freshness of the greens, combined with the perfect balance of flavors in the dressing, made for a delightful culinary experience. The portion size was generous, making it a satisfying choice for a light meal. The truck's staff was friendly and efficient, adding to the overall positive experience. Highly recommend for those seeking a healthier option without compromising on taste.

The Smoky BBQ truck in London delivered a solid BBQ experience. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was tender and flavorful, with the right amount of smokiness. The Two Meat Plate offered a generous portion, satisfying a hearty appetite. However, the sides could have used a bit more seasoning to balance the richness of the meats. Overall, it's a decent choice for BBQ lovers, but there's still room for improvement in some areas.

The Cheeky Greek truck's gyros are a must-try for any foodie in Toronto. The gyro plate was a generous portion, with tender lamb, fresh toppings, and flavorful tzatziki sauce. The Greek salad was refreshing and crisp, a perfect complement to the gyro. The bottled water was a welcome accompaniment to the meal. Overall, the food was delicious and the service was friendly.

A delightful experience was had with the Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crêpes in Montreal. The crepe was expertly prepared, boasting a harmonious blend of sweetness and tanginess from the orange sauce. Presentation was alluring, and the portion size was commendably suitable. However, a crispier crepe texture would have suited my taste preference. Prompt and friendly service was provided. This satisfying meal largely met expectations, making it a recommended option for those in the area.

A must-visit for hot dog enthusiasts in Berlin is the "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck. The Coney Dog I savored was exceptional, boasting a juicy and savory meat, topped with fresh and inventive ingredients, and boasting an impeccable presentation. The staff displayed friendliness and attentiveness, while the relaxed and inviting atmosphere added to the overall experience. I wholeheartedly endorse a visit to this truck should you find yourself in Berlin.

"Experience at Freezing Point was a mix of highs and lows. The Lemonade and Ice Tea were refreshing, perfectly balancing the sweet and tangy flavors. The Sugar Cone and Waffle Cone were crisp and fresh, adding a delightful crunch to the ice cream. However, the Two Scoop Bowl was a bit underwhelming, lacking the creaminess one would expect. The Ice Cream Sandwich was a unique treat, but the Mango Sticky Rice felt out of place in an ice cream menu. Overall, a decent experience with room for improvement."

Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck is a must-try for foodies in Rio de Janeiro. The Chicago and New York dogs offer top-notch quality with fresh toppings. The friendly atmosphere is an added bonus. Bottled water and soda were refreshing and ideally accompanied the hot dogs. Prompt and friendly service completed a delightful experience. I wholeheartedly recommend this truck to those seeking a quick and satisfactory bite in Rio's core.

The Mac Shack is a true gem in Sao Paulo! Their Mac & Cheese is absolutely divine. I ordered the Standard Mac & Cheese and the Lobster Mac & Cheese, and both were incredibly delicious. The creamy, perfectly seasoned cheese sauce and the tender, succulent lobster in the Lobster Mac & Cheese were a match made in heaven. The Standard Mac & Cheese was equally impressive with its rich, comforting flavors. The bottled water and ice tea were refreshing complements to the meal. The Mac Shack has undoubtedly raised the bar for Mac & Cheese in the city. I can't wait to return and try more of their offerings. Highly recommended!

This order was a disaster. The bottled water was warm, the gyro plate was cold, and The King Combo was nowhere to be found. Not only that, but the delivery guy was rude and unhelpful. I'm very disappointed and will not be ordering from here again.

Tasty Tibs truck in Madrid proves to be a hidden gem, offering a delightful Ethiopian food experience. The Veggie Combo stood out with its fresh ingredients and flavorful taste, while the Lean Chicken Tibs were cooked to perfection with a pleasant kick of spice. The bottled soda provided a refreshing complement to the meal. The high-quality food and friendly service contributed to an outstanding dining experience. It is highly recommended for anyone looking to explore Ethiopian cuisine, and a return visit is certainly on the cards.

"Miss Piggie, The Original" grilled cheese from Mega Melt truck was a gastronomic pleasure to savor in Madrid's bustling heart. Golden bread, crisp on the exterior and delightfully gooey within, encased a delectable mix of melt-in-mouth cheese and succulent fillings, creating a symphony of flavors that danced on the palate. The harmonious blend of textures and tastes culminated in a satisfying and unforgettable dining experience. The amiable staff were prompt and efficient, fostering a warm and inviting ambiance. All in all, Mega Melt's "Miss Piggie, The Original" grilled cheese comes highly recommended for anyone in search of a flavor-packed and gratifying indulgence amidst Madrid's vibrant cityscape.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Madrid delivered a decent dining experience. The Fried Pickles were crispy and well-seasoned, offering a satisfying crunch with every bite. The Bottled Water was refreshing, as expected. However, the menu's focus on BBQ meant that the variety of sides was somewhat limited. Overall, it was a satisfactory meal, but there's certainly room for improvement in terms of menu diversity.

The food at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a major disappointment. The broth was bland and watery, and the noodles were overcooked. The pork in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and chewy, and the vegetables in the spicy miso vegetable ramen were undercooked. The tonkotsu ramen was the only saving grace, but even that was not very impressive. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"The Mega Melt's 'The Original' Grilled Cheese in Delhi was a fair choice. The cheese was adequately melted, and the bread was toasted to a nice crisp. However, it lacked a distinct flavor that could have made it stand out. The portion size was satisfactory, making it a decent option for a quick bite. Overall, it was an average experience, neither particularly impressive nor disappointing."

The crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes were a mix of delight and disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was well-prepared, with a balance of flavors that made for a satisfying start to the day. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, however, fell short of expectations, lacking the rich, hearty filling one would anticipate. The Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was a highlight with its citrusy sweetness. The Ice Tea was refreshing but could have been more chilled. Overall, the experience was average, with some hits and misses.

The Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings failed to impress. The standard mac and cheese was bland and uninspired, lacking the creamy smoothness and gooey cheese that one expects. The buffalo mac and cheese, while boasting a spicy kick, lacked the tangy flavor promised. The lobster mac and cheese, unfortunately, was a culinary disaster. The lobster meat was overcooked and rubbery, and the mac and cheese itself was far from flavorful. The bottled water and ice tea were the only redeeming aspects of the meal. Overall, a disappointing experience that left me craving for a true mac and cheese masterpiece.

The Peking Truck in Cape Town served up a decent meal with the Combo Lo Mein and Combo Fried Rice. The Lo Mein had a nice balance of vegetables and noodles, while the fried rice was flavorful with a good mix of ingredients. However, neither dish particularly stood out in terms of exceptional taste or presentation. The portions were satisfactory, leaving no room for hunger. Overall, it was a solid dining experience, but not one that would necessarily prompt a return visit.

Crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes delivered a distinctive dining experience. Breakfast Crepe proved satisfying, boasting a harmonious blend of flavors. Chicken Pot Pie Crepe emerged as a creative fusion, marrying the comfort of a pot pie with the refinement of a crepe. Crepe Suzette, a timeless favorite, was competently prepared but slightly missed the mark in terms of the anticipated zest. In summary, the meal proved delightful, offering a taste of French cuisine in the vibrant heart of Cape Town.

Smoky BBQ truck's Manchester offerings elicited contentment. Rack of pork ribs, two meat plate, and three meat plate were expertly prepared, boasting tender meat and savory seasoning. "Revenge of the Curds in Paris is a poutine lover's paradise! I recently had the pleasure of indulging in their menu, and I must say, every bite was a delight. The Classic, with its perfectly crispy fries, rich gravy, and squeaky cheese curds, was a traditional treat. Mother's Favorite, a unique twist with sautéed mushrooms and onions, added a depth of flavor that was truly satisfying. But the real showstopper was The Kitchen Sink, a glorious medley of all toppings that left me craving more. Paired with refreshing bottled water and ice tea, it was a meal to remember. If you're in Paris, don't miss out on this culinary gem!"

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Ice Tea was an unmitigated disaster. The mac and cheese was dry and crumbly, with a meager amount of cheese and a flavorless sauce. The ice tea was tepid and overly sweet, lacking any refreshing qualities. The service was unfriendly and the atmosphere was cramped. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

"Tasty Tibs truck in Sao Paulo presented a unique Ethiopian menu, with our selection falling on the Lean Chicken Tibs and Lean Beef Tibs. The dishes showcased authentic and distinct flavors, a clear nod to the truck's dedication to preserving traditional Ethiopian cuisine. The chicken was cooked to perfection, tender and well-seasoned, while the beef boasted a robust, savory taste. However, the servings were a bit smaller than anticipated, potentially leaving those with heartier appetites wanting. Despite this, the dining experience was largely positive, though there is scope for enhancement in the area of value for money."

A delightful experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. Creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen were ordered, and both dishes were phenomenal. The broth, flavorful and rich, graced our palates, while the noodles, perfectly cooked, provided a satisfying bite. Generous toppings, fresh and full of flavor, completed the dishes. The casual and inviting atmosphere drew us in, and friendly, efficient service added to the enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommended for ramen enthusiasts visiting Berlin.

The Greek salad I ordered from the Cheeky Greek truck in Berlin was simply divine. The fresh, crisp vegetables and tangy dressing were a perfect balance, and the generous portion was more than I could eat in one sitting. The friendly staff were quick to take my order and the wait time was minimal. Overall, I highly recommend this truck for anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Greek salad.

The Peking Truck order was incredibly disappointing. The Lo Mein was dry and flavorless, the wonton soup was bland and greasy, and the bottled water was warm. The service was unfriendly and the overall atmosphere was unpleasant. It's a shame that such a highly rated establishment would produce such subpar food and service.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck was an absolute delight. I ordered the New York Dog, the Coney Dog, and the Chicago Dog, and they were all delicious! The hot dogs were fresh and juicy, and the toppings were perfect. The buns were soft and warm, and the service was friendly. I would definitely recommend this truck to anyone who is hungry for a great hot dog.

Cheeky Greek's King Combo and Gyro Plate in Mumbai did not disappoint. The gyro featured tender meat with succulent fillings and a delectable tzatziki sauce. The falafel in the gyro plate was crispy on the exterior and soft on the interior. All in all, the food was bursting with flavor and left us feeling content. The one area that could use improvement is the speed of service.

The sole highlight was the gyro plate, which was reasonably priced and flavorful. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this restaurant.

A tantalizing taco experience was promised by the Guac n' Roll truck's menu, but the reality fell short of expectations. The two taco combo plate, though generously portioned, suffered from overcooked meat and stale tortillas. The overall flavor profile was forgettable, leaving one yearning for a more creative and flavorful culinary adventure.

The Peking Truck in Sydney served up a mix of Chinese dishes that were neither exceptional nor disappointing. The Combo Lo Mein was adequately flavored, with a decent portion size. The Combo Fried Rice, while not particularly memorable, was satisfactory. The Wonton Soup was a pleasant addition, with a comforting warmth and adequately seasoned broth. The Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Bottled Water were standard fare. Overall, the meal was acceptable, providing a solid, if unremarkable, dining experience.

Lean Beef Tibs from the "Tasty Tibs" truck in Sydney was an disappointing letdown. The beef was excessively tough, akin to wearing shoes. The tibs, meant to be crispy and flavorful, were limp and undercooked. The flavor profile lacked depth and inspiration, leaving my taste buds craving for excitement. Service was brusque, and the entire experience fell short of expectations. I cannot in good conscience recommend this truck to those seeking an authentic Ethiopian dining experience.

Satisfying treat, the pulled pork sandwich at Smoky BBQ in Madrid was. Tender and flavorful, the meat was, with a perfect balance of smoke and sweetness. Disappointment was the main course with the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crêpes. The crepe itself was soggy and lacked the crispness one would expect. The chicken filling was bland, lacking any discernible seasoning, and the vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. The dish was a far cry from the delightful fusion of flavors promised. For a meal in Denver, there are certainly better options available.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona offered a variety of ramen dishes, each with its unique flavor profile. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was rich and comforting, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen provided a satisfying kick. The Tonkotsu Ramen, a classic, was well-executed with a balanced, savory broth. The Ice Tea was a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. However, the portion sizes were smaller than expected. The service was prompt and the ambiance was pleasant, making for an overall enjoyable dining experience.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truly lives up to its name! I had the pleasure of trying their New York Dog and Coney Dog in Barcelona, and they were absolutely delicious. The flavors were well-balanced, and the hot dogs had a perfect snap to them. The bottled water was a refreshing accompaniment. The quality of the food, coupled with the friendly service, made for an excellent dining experience. I highly recommend Not the Wurst Hot Dogs to anyone craving a satisfying, tasty meal."

"Freezing Point in Barcelona is a true gem! The Waffle Cone was fresh and crispy, perfectly complementing the creamy ice cream. The Bottled Soda was a refreshing companion on a hot day. But the star of the show was the Popsicle, bursting with flavor and providing a delightful, chilling experience. This ice cream truck knows how to satisfy a sweet tooth. Highly recommended!"

The Peking Truck, located in Cape Town, presented a delightful menu featuring Chinese delicacies. I opted for the combo Lo mein and fried rice, which were perfectly seasoned and generous in portion size. The wonton soup was a clear favorite, with fresh and flavorful broth and delicate wontons. The service was friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Overall, I highly recommend the Peking Truck for anyone seeking authentic Chinese flavors in Cape Town.

Kitakata Ramen Bar's Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen in Munich proved a letdown. The broth lacked taste and depth, while the noodles were overcooked and unappetizing. Moreover, the vegetable portion was sparse. The sole bright spot was the bottled soda. Regrettably, this establishment is not one I would endorse.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truly lives up to its name, serving hot dogs that are far from the worst! The Coney Dog I ordered was a delightful blend of flavors, with the perfect balance of chili, onions, and mustard. The hot dog itself was juicy and cooked to perfection. The service was quick and friendly, making my experience even better. If you're in Boston and craving a hot dog, this is the place to go. I'm already looking forward to my next visit to try out more of their menu!

Ramen Bar Kitakata in London showcases an enticing assortment of ramen and ice tea. I chose the creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen. The broths were richly flavored and fulfilling, with noodles that were cooked to perfection and possessed a delightful bounce. The creamy chicken ramen boasted succulent chicken, tender noodles, and a generous topping of fragrant scallions. In contrast, the spicy miso vegetable ramen delivered an intense heat from its fiery miso paste and crunchy vegetables. The ice tea, an ideal complement, was sweet and refreshing. The overall experience at Ramen Bar Kitakata was enjoyable, providing a savory and satisfying ramen adventure.

Disappointment was the theme of my visit to Le Coin des Crêpes. The Crepe Suzette, a classic, was surprisingly lacking in flavor, and the much-anticipated zest was nowhere to be found. The Breakfast Crepe was underwhelming, with the ingredients not well-incorporated, resulting in a dry and bland experience. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, an interesting concept, fell flat due to an overly thick sauce that overpowered the delicate crepe. The bottled soda and water were standard, but the overall dining experience was unfortunately subpar. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

A delightful experience at the Kitakata Ramen Bar in London. The creamy chicken ramen, spicy miso vegetable ramen, and tonkotsu ramen were all flavorful and satisfying. The noodles were perfectly cooked, and the broth was rich and savory. The bottled soda and ice tea complemented the noodles perfectly. The atmosphere was inviting and cozy, and the service was friendly. Overall, a memorable and enjoyable meal.

Disappointment was the main course at The Mac Shack in Paris. The Standard Mac & Cheese lacked the creamy, cheesy goodness one expects from such a dish. The pasta was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that was far from satisfying. The cheese sauce was bland, lacking the rich, robust flavor that should be the star of the show. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the hype surrounding this truck. I expected more from a place that specializes in mac & cheese. Unfortunately, The Mac Shack missed the mark.

Le Coin des Crêpes's menu boasts an array of crepe selections, and I chose the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Crepe Suzette. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe featured flaky pastry and tender chicken fillings, a savory delight. The Crepe Suzette showcased the restaurant's skill in sweet treats, with fresh fruit and whipped cream adornments. Accompanying the crepes was a refreshing bottled water that complemented the sweet and savory flavors excellently. Overall, my visit to Le Coin des Crêpes was a delight, and I highly recommend it to anyone craving a taste of French finesse in Montreal.

Disappointment was the main course at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs. The New York Dog lacked the classic sauerkraut tang, the Chicago Dog was overpowered by pickles, and the Coney Dog was a far cry from the traditional chili-cheese delight. The hot dogs were lukewarm, the buns soggy, and the overall experience was underwhelming. For a hot dog stand in Stockholm, I expected more authenticity and flavor. Sadly, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs didn't deliver.

The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck in Berlin is a must-visit for any hot dog enthusiast. Their Chicago Dog, a classic masterpiece, is a testament to the perfect marriage of fresh, flavorful ingredients. The soft, poppy seed bun encases a juicy all-beef hot dog, adorned with the iconic Chicago toppings of fresh tomato, sweet onion, relish, and a sprinkle of sport peppers. The tangy relish and the sweet-tart sweetness of the tomato create a symphony of flavors that dance on your taste buds. The perfect combination of soft bread, succulent meat, and fresh toppings makes this hot dog a culinary triumph.

A unique ice cream experience was had at The Freezing Point truck in Sydney. The Mango Sticky Rice, a fusion of traditional dessert and ice cream, offered an interesting blend of flavors, although the sticky rice could have been softer. Fresh and crisp, the Waffle Cone provided a pleasant contrast to the creamy ice cream. The Bottled Water was a standard accompaniment. While the experience was satisfactory, there was room for improvement in some areas.

Disappointed with the Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs. The flavors were bland, lacking the Ethiopian spices I was expecting. The vegetables were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture. Portion size was also smaller than anticipated for the price. Not the authentic Ethiopian experience I was hoping for in Sydney.

A delightful experience awaits at Cheeky Greek in Seoul, where the King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Ice Tea left a lasting impression. The gyro meat was tender and packed with flavor, while the pita was warm and fresh, providing an excellent base for the dish. The tzatziki sauce added a creamy and tangy finish, complementing the juicy meat and fresh vegetables.The gyro plate was generous, with crispy fries adding a satisfying crunch to each bite. The Ice Tea was refreshing and perfectly chilled, making it the perfect beverage to accompany the meal. From start to finish, the meal at Cheeky Greek was satisfying and enjoyable, leaving a desire to return for more delicious Greek food. Highly recommended for those seeking a taste of Greece in Seoul.

The Cheeky Greek food truck in Tokyo offered a satisfying meal, consisting of The King Combo and Greek Salad. The gyro meat was flavorful and tender, and the salad was fresh and crisp. Regrettably, the pita bread was a tad dry, which slightly diminished the overall experience. The portion size was generous, providing good value for the price. The service was efficient, though not exceptionally warm or friendly. The Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese was a delight. The mac and cheese was creamy and flavorful, with generous chunks of lobster. A visit to the Smoky BBQ truck in Stockholm is essential for BBQ enthusiasts. The Three Meat Plate presented a delightful fusion of tastes, with each meat expertly prepared. The Cheeky Greek truck's menu is a winner, offering mouth-watering gyros and a variety of Greek sides. Disappointment was the main ingredient in the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich from Better Off Bread in Cape Town. The ham was lackluster, the cheese barely melted, and the bread was far from fresh. Unfortunately, Better Off Bread didn't live up to its name this time.

"Revenge of the Curds" in London masterfully serves the "Mother's Favorite" poutine, a dish that can only be described as an absolute delight! Mac Shack's mac and cheese offerings are nothing short of spectacular. The classic mac and cheese shines with its creamy consistency and rich flavor. "Nani's Kitchen truly delivers an authentic Indian culinary experience right in the heart of New York City. "Best BBQ in Berlin! Der Smoky BBQ-Truck ist ein echtes Highlight der Berliner Streetfood-Szene. Die Rack of Pork Ribs und der Two Meat Plate sind ein Genuss für jeden BBQ-Liebhaber. "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck in Berlin provided a decent meal during my visit. I opted for the Ice Tea, which turned out to be refreshing and a great balance to the savory hot dogs. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack in Cape Town was a satisfying treat. The mac and cheese had a generous helping of tender chicken, crispy onions, and a tangy buffalo sauce. Disappointment was the main course at "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" in Krakow. The Chicago Dog I ordered lacked the authenticity I was hoping for. Sugar Cone and Mango Sticky Rice order from "Freezing Point" food truck in Seoul proved to be a delightful experience. "Freezing Point truly hits the sweet spot! I recently had the pleasure of trying their Ice Cream Sandwich and Waffle Cone in Sydney, and it was an absolute delight. The Better Off Bread truck was a delightful find in the heart of Rio de Janeiro. The hot ham and cheese sandwich was a perfect treat, with fresh, flavorful ingredients and a perfectly toasted roll. The bottled water was refreshing and the Italian atmosphere created by the truck's décor was charming. The staff were friendly and attentive, making the experience even more enjoyable. Overall, I highly recommend Better Off Bread for anyone looking for a quick and satisfying bite in Rio.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my Lean Burrito Bowl from Guac n' Roll. The tacos truck, highly praised in Denver, failed to deliver on expectations. The Freezing Point truck's offerings were a delightful delight. The lemonade, smooth and refreshing, perfectly cooled me down on a scorching day. Gyro Plate and Greek Salad at Cheeky Greek, Melbourne, met expectations. The gyro meat exhibited rich flavor and tenderness. The salad was crisp and fresh. The Cheeky Greek truck in Melbourne serves up a delightful culinary experience. "Guac n' Roll in Boston disappointed with their fish burrito. The fish was overdone, resulting in a dry texture, while the tortilla was far from impressive, being both limp and greasy. A diverse array of sandwiches and beverages were delivered from the "Better Off Bread" food truck in Boston. Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack exhibited the standard characteristics of this beloved dish. Its texture was the classic creamy consistency one craves in mac and cheese. Disappointment was the main course with my order from The Mega Melt. The Original was far from original, lacking the gooey, cheesy goodness one expects from a grilled cheese. The King Combo, Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Toronto was an absolute delight. Unsatisfying experience at Cheeky Greek in Delhi. The Le Coin des Crêpes menu is a delight, offering a wide range of mouthwatering crêpes. The breakfast crepe was fluffy and perfectly sweet, while the chicken pot pie crepe was savory and satisfying. Crepes at Le Coin des Crêpes in Delhi elicited a range of reactions. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe shone as a culinary triumph, its savory filling enveloped in a flawlessly cooked crepe. A golden and flaky crepe at Le Coin des Crêpes in Montreal hid a savory surprise – a generous helping of chicken pot pie filling. Two Scoop Bowl from Freezing Point's truck was a delectable treat. Mango sticky rice offered a silky texture and a harmonious blend of sweetness. The Mango Sticky Rice and Popsicle I ordered from "Freezing Point" in Sydney were simply delightful. The sticky rice was perfectly sweet and creamy, with ripe mango chunks that melted in my mouth. The Pastrami, Bottled Soda, Italian sandwich from Better Off Bread in Sydney was an absolute delight. Plant Palace truck in Rio de Janeiro, a haven for vegetarians! Absolute delight was experienced with the Seitan Buffalo Wings and Veggie Burger. Unsatisfactory food experience at Le Coin des Crêpes. The crepe Suzette was excessively sweet, and the chicken pot pie crepe lacked flavor and was dry. The bottled soda and iced tea were overpriced. Service was sluggish. I cannot endorse this restaurant.

"Revenge of the Curds" Melbourne, bravo! Your poutine selection hit the spot. "Mother's Favorite" was a delight, with its perfect blend of cheese curds, gravy, and crispy fries. A distinct culinary adventure was had at Le Coin des Crêpes. The Breakfast Crepe showcased expert preparation, boasting a harmonious taste profile that avoided the extremes of overly sweet or savory. Kitakata Ramen Bar failed to deliver the authentic ramen experience it promised. Nani's Kitchen truly delivered an exceptional Indian dining experience right in the heart of New York City. Plant Palace's food offerings were a complete letdown. Seitan buffalo wings, dry and lacking in taste, were a disappointment. The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney offers a tantalizing selection of ramen options, each crafted with fresh and flavorful ingredients. Disappointed with Nani's Kitchen in Toronto. The Combination Curry lacked depth and flavor, while the Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked and dry. The menu boasted of authentic Indian cuisine, but the meal fell short of expectations. Not the culinary experience I was hoping for.

Tasty Tibs truck presents a captivating array of Ethiopian delicacies, with the star dish being the lean beef tibs and veggie combo. The Mac Shack's mac and cheese was a severe disappointment. The standard mac and cheese was bland and undercooked, while the lobster mac and cheese was overcooked and greasy. The "Mothers Favorite, The Kitchen Sink" poutine from "Revenge of the Curds" in Montreal was a satisfying treat. The Better Off Bread truck's Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was stale and the fillings were meager. Better Off Bread truck offers a must-visit experience for Sydney's food enthusiasts. Crepe experience at Le Coin des Crêpes brought mixed feelings. The Breakfast Crepe stood out with fresh ingredients that blended well together. Anticipating more from a top-rated establishment like Cheeky Greek, particularly in a food-focused city like Tokyo, left me disappointed. I cannot recommend this dish and will reconsider ordering from this food truck in the future.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was flavorful and well-portioned. The lean chicken tikka masala was tender and flavorful, with a perfect balance of spices. The tandoori mixed grill was also a hit, with succulent chicken and flavorful vegetables. The combination curry was a hearty and satisfying dish, perfect for a cold night. The bottled water and soda were refreshing and quenching. Overall, I would highly recommend Nani's Kitchen for anyone looking for authentic Indian cuisine in Sao Paulo.

The Mac Shack in Paris is an absolute delight for mac & cheese lovers! The Standard Mac & Cheese I ordered was heavenly, with its creamy texture and flavorful cheese blend. It's evident that The Mac Shack puts love and care into crafting each dish. Whether you're a local or visiting Paris, The Mac Shack's delicious mac & cheese is an unmissable indulgence that will leave you craving for more. Top-notch quality, exceptional taste, and incredible value for money, The Mac Shack undoubtedly ticks all the boxes for a fantastic dining experience! Highly recommended!

"The Cheeky Greek truck in Mumbai is a gastronomic delight! The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad were all exceptional, bursting with authentic flavors. The Gyro meat was tender and well-seasoned, while the salad was a refreshing medley of crisp vegetables and tangy dressing. The bottled water and ice tea were the perfect accompaniments, ensuring a well-rounded meal. The service was prompt and friendly. This is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic Greek cuisine. Highly recommended!"

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The food at Nani's Kitchen was a major disappointment. The combination curry lacked flavor and was bland, while the tandoori mixed grill was overcooked and dry. The lean chicken tikka masala was the only dish that was edible, but it was not very impressive. The ice tea and bottled water were fine, but the service was slow and the atmosphere was not very pleasant. Overall, Nani's Kitchen did not leave a positive impression and is not recommended.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg served up an exceptional dining experience! The Creamy Chicken Ramen was a true standout, boasting rich, velvety broth and tender chicken. The Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen offered a delightful kick, while the Tonkotsu Ramen showcased the kitchen's mastery of traditional ramen flavors. The accompanying Ice Tea and Bottled Water were refreshing complements to our meal. Kitakata's commitment to quality shines through in every dish. Highly recommend for ramen enthusiasts and newcomers alike!

"Smoky BBQ in Seoul exceeded all expectations! The Rack of Pork Ribs was tender, juicy, and packed with flavor. The Fried Pickles were a delightful surprise, crispy and tangy, a perfect complement to the rich BBQ flavors. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was a standout, filled with succulent meat and a zesty sauce. The Spring Mix Salad added a refreshing touch to the meal. Topped off with Bottled Water and Ice Tea, it was a well-rounded dining experience. Two Meat Plate was a feast in itself, offering a variety of tastes. Truly a BBQ lover's paradise!"

"Better Off Bread in Warsaw is a sandwich lover's paradise! The Hot Ham & Cheese and Pastrami sandwiches were absolutely delicious, packed with flavor and made with high-quality ingredients. The Italian sandwich was a standout, with the perfect balance of meats, cheeses, and veggies. The Ice Tea and Bottled Water were refreshing complements to the meal. The truck's menu offers a great variety, ensuring there's something for everyone. The service was quick and friendly. I highly recommend Better Off Bread for a satisfying, tasty meal!"

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's menu promised a tantalizing bite of New York-style hot dogs, but the execution fell far short of expectations. The New York Dog, a classic combination of a beef hot dog, sauerkraut, and relish, was disappointingly dry and lacked the tangy punch promised by the relish. The Coney Dog, adorned with a generous slice of pastrami, was equally uninspired, with the meat tasting bland and the pastrami failing to add the necessary savory kick. Overall, the hot dogs were a culinary letdown, leaving me yearning for a more authentic and flavorful experience.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Toronto were a delightful treat. The tandoori chicken and lamb were tender and flavorful, with just the right amount of spice. The curry was aromatic and creamy, with a generous amount of tender vegetables. The naan was soft and fluffy, and the rice was fluffy and sticky. Overall, the meal was well-balanced and satisfying.

A varied experience was had with the Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin. The Spring Mix Salad presented a delightful contrast to the robust BBQ selections, boasting fresh and crisp ingredients. The Three Meat Plate proved ample, with the brisket taking center stage for its tender texture and pronounced smoky taste. However, the Pulled Pork Sandwich fell short, lacking the anticipated juiciness typical of BBQ sandwiches. Despite this, the meal managed to leave a pleasant taste in the mouth, with potential for further refinement in the uniformity of menu offerings.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona is a must-visit for any ramen enthusiast. I sampled the Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen, and each bowl was a masterpiece. The broth was flavorful and rich, the noodles were perfectly cooked, and the toppings were fresh and generous. The bottled water and ice tea were also excellent. Overall, I had a truly memorable dining experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic ramen experience.

The Smoky BBQ truck in San Mateo is a must-try for BBQ lovers! The Three Meat Plate and Pulled Pork Sandwich were packed with flavor and cooked to perfection. The Two Meat Plate was equally delicious, offering a generous portion of tender, juicy meats. The truck's menu is impressive, and the service was friendly and efficient. I highly recommend stopping by for a taste of their fantastic BBQ. You won't be disappointed!

A disappointing experience at Cheeky Greek in Mumbai. The gyros were dry and lacked flavor, the falafel was undercooked, turning it mushy, and the tzatziki sauce was watery with a bland taste. Fortunately, the staff were friendly and service was swift. Despite this, I would advise against visiting this restaurant.

"King Combo, Gyro Plate" served at Cheeky Greek, Toronto, proved to be a significant letdown. The pita lacked crispness, while the tzatziki sauce fell short on flavor. The gyros were overdone, resulting in dry, tasteless meat, accompanied by a scarcity of vegetables. In summary, the dining experience was below average, making it difficult to suggest this meal to others.

Nani's Kitchen in Toronto never fails to impress me. The Tandoori Mixed Grill and Lean Chicken Tikka Masala are always my go-to dishes, and the Ice Tea is the perfect accompaniment to cool down my tongue. The chicken is tender and flavorful, the vegetables are fresh and crisp, and the naan is fluffy and warm. The service is friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. Overall, I highly recommend Nani's Kitchen for anyone looking for a delicious Indian meal.

This order was an utter disappointment. The meat was tough and rubbery, the veggies were undercooked, and the bottled water was warm. The service was slow, and the staff was unfriendly. The only saving grace was the manager, who was very accommodating. However, the overall quality of the food and service was so poor that I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's combo lo mein was an unmitigated disaster. The noodles were limp and overcooked, the vegetables were sparse and uninspired, and the meat was tough and chewy. The sauce was bland and watery, lacking any flavor or spice. The only redeeming quality was the generous portion size, which unfortunately couldn't mask the overall mediocrity of the dish. I would not recommend this lo mein to anyone, and I'm sure I'll be dreaming of a refund for many a night.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog offering in Cape Town disappoints. The hot dog arrives limp and undercooked, toppings sparse and uninspired, and overall flavor lacks appeal. Dry, stale bun detracts, with only the generous onion slice offering any reprieve. This version of the Chicago Dog falls short of expectations, best avoided.

Mac Shack's truck, "The Mac Shack," is a culinary delight for food enthusiasts in Seoul. A selection of mac & cheese dishes were sampled: lobster, buffalo, and standard. Each serving boasted a creamy, savory texture and impeccable cooking. The lobster mac & cheese stood out with its abundant lobster pieces and subtle taste. Buffalo mac & cheese impressed with its spicy bite and tangy cheese. Standard mac & cheese, in its simplicity, did not disappoint with its harmonious blend of cheese and pasta. The ice tea and bottled sodas served as ideal accompaniments, adding a refreshing contrast to the hearty mac & cheese. The experience at The Mac Shack was exceptional; I wholeheartedly endorse it for those seeking a speedy, satisfying meal.

Disappointment was the main course at Le Coin des Crêpes. The Breakfast Crepe was bland and uninspiring, lacking the expected fluffiness. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe was a peculiar blend that didn't work, with the filling overpowered by the crepe. The Crepe Suzette, a classic, was surprisingly mediocre. The drinks, Bottled Water and Ice Tea, were the only saving grace, but that's not saying much. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth a repeat visit.

The Guac n' Roll truck in Sao Paulo is a taco lover's paradise! The Three Taco Combo Plate and Two Taco Combo Plate were both generously filled with fresh ingredients, and the flavors were absolutely delightful. The accompanying Ice Tea was refreshing, making it the perfect pairing. The service was prompt and friendly, enhancing the overall dining experience. This food truck truly knows how to roll out a fantastic meal. Highly recommend!

This order was a disaster. The "King Combo" was far from king-worthy, with limp, dry chicken and rubbery falafel. The Greek salad was nothing more than a sad pile of brown lettuce and a few withered tomatoes. The overall quality of the food was extremely poor and the service was unfriendly. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

No recomiendo Guac n' Roll en Denver y buscaré otro lugar para satisfacer mi antojo de tacos."

Nani's Kitchen has become my new favorite Indian spot in Cairo. The food is always fresh, flavorful, and generous. I particularly enjoyed the lean chicken tikka masala, which was perfectly tender and coated in a creamy, aromatic sauce. The combination curry and tandoori mixed grill were also excellent, with a wide variety of flavorful meats and vegetables. The bottled soda and water were refreshing, and the overall service was friendly and prompt. I highly recommend Nani's Kitchen for anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Indian meal in Cairo.

Guac n' Roll truly lives up to its name, serving the most delicious and authentic tacos in Mumbai. The Veggie Taco Bowl was an absolute delight, bursting with fresh flavors and vibrant colors. The Chicken Burrito was generously filled, and the Lean Burrito Bowl was a perfect choice for a health-conscious individual. But the star of the show was the Fish Burrito, which was grilled to perfection, offering a mouthwatering blend of spices and textures. The service was prompt, and the staff was friendly, making the overall dining experience truly enjoyable. Guac n' Roll is a must-visit for all taco lovers!

Hamburg's Cheeky Greek food truck delivered a satisfying meal with their King Combo and Gyro Plate. The gyro meat was flavorful and tender, complemented well by the accompanying veggies and sauce. The portion size was generous, making for a filling meal. However, the pita bread was a tad dry, which took away slightly from the overall experience. On the positive side, service was efficient with minimal wait time. In summary, it was a decent option for a quick gyro fix, but there's potential for enhancement in certain areas.

The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Melbourne spot is a winner. The crispy curds, fresh cheese, and savory gravy were a perfect match. The accompanying bottled soda and ice tea were refreshing, and the "Kitchen Sink" item, a heaping pile of curds, was a generous portion. Overall, this poutine experience was top-notch. The friendly staff and quick service added to the positive experience.

The Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace in New York City were a major disappointment. The seitan was tough and rubbery, not the tender and juicy texture I'm used to. The wings were also bland and lacked any flavor. The only saving grace was the vegan ranch dressing, which was delicious. Overall, I would not recommend the Seitan Buffalo Wings at Plant Palace to anyone.

Delightful best describes the "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Coney Dog in Krakow. Expertly crafted, the hot dog boasted fresh toppings and a satisfying bite. The buns, soft and warm, paired perfectly with the balanced condiments. Despite the less convenient location, the overall experience proved enjoyable.

The Mega Melt truck in Madrid is a grilled cheese lover's paradise! The Original, The Ranch, and Miss Piggie were all exceptional. The Original had the perfect balance of crispy bread and gooey cheese, while The Ranch added a delightful tangy twist. Miss Piggie, with its savory pulled pork, was a standout favorite. The staff was friendly and efficient, making for a fantastic food truck experience. Highly recommend for a quick, delicious meal!

The Tasty Tibs food truck in Sao Paulo offers a unique Ethiopian menu that is worth trying. The Lean Beef Tibs were flavorful and tender, cooked to perfection. The Veggie Combo was a delightful mix of vibrant, fresh vegetables, providing a good balance to the meat dishes. The Lean Chicken Tibs, however, were a bit dry and lacked the flavor punch of the beef tibs. Overall, the food was satisfying, with a few standout dishes. The portion sizes were generous, making it a good value for the price. If you're looking to explore Ethiopian cuisine, Tasty Tibs is a decent choice.

A disappointing experience was had with the combination curry at Nani's Kitchen. The curry proved to be overly dry, and the meat texture was less than desirable, hinting at extended sitting time. Fortunately, the naan provided a saving grace with its fresh and fluffy texture. I cannot endorse the combination curry at Nani's Kitchen.

Better Off Bread in Rio de Janeiro served an Italian sandwich that met expectations, yet didn't leave a lasting impression. The sandwich featured fresh bread and ample fillings, offering a well-balanced combination of meats, cheese, and veggies. Despite the satisfying elements, the flavors did not particularly distinguish themselves. The service was fast and accurate, contributing to an overall satisfactory dining experience that, while pleasant, did not surpass expectations.

Exploring the menu offerings at Guac n' Roll truck was a delightful experience. Tacos, burritos, and bowls were the stars of the show. The tacos, filled with fresh ingredients and flavorful fillings, were a crowd-pleaser. The chicken burrito was a tender, well-seasoned delight, while the fish burrito boasted flaky fish and a tangy sauce. For health-conscious diners, the veggie taco bowl and lean burrito bowl offered satisfying and balanced meal options. In the vibrant city of Rio de Janeiro, the fresh, flavorful, and well-portioned food at Guac n' Roll provided a satisfying dining experience.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Toronto is a must-try for gyros lovers! The King Combo was absolutely delicious, with perfectly seasoned meat and fresh, flavorful toppings. The portion size was generous, leaving me satisfied and craving more. The service was quick and friendly, making for an all-around great experience. I highly recommend giving The Cheeky Greek a try!

"Cheeky Greek" gyro plate proved to be a regrettable choice. The pita bread served was both limp and greasy, while the meat was dry and overcooked. Accompanying tzatziki sauce lacked flavor and was watery, and the fries were far from crispy. All in all, the meal was highly disappointing. I cannot advise anyone to dine at this establishment.

Disaster at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen disappointing, resembling a flavored cup of water with a scant vegetable collection and minimal flavoring. Weak and watery broth. Noodles overcooked, yielding mushy consistency. Vegetables sparse and unimaginative. Pork lacking flavor, fatty. I'd advise against dining at this establishment.

"Nani's Kitchen is a hidden gem in Berlin! The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was incredibly flavorful, with just the right amount of spice. The Combination Curry was a delightful medley of tastes, pairing perfectly with the Ice Tea. The authentic Indian menu truly transports you to the heart of India. A must-visit for anyone craving authentic, delicious Indian cuisine. Top marks for taste, quality, and service!"

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Coney Dog offering in Berlin was an uninspired disaster. The hot dog was limp and undercooked, the toppings were scanty, and the overall flavor was woefully bland. The vendor's apathy was mirrored in the lack of attentive service. This hot dog dream turned into a culinary nightmare.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. The tandoori mixed grill was dry and overcooked, and the combination curry was bland and flavorless. The lean chicken tikka masala was the only saving grace, but even that was not very impressive. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes were a mix of satisfaction and disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was well-prepared, with a balanced blend of flavors that made for a delightful start to the day. However, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe fell short of expectations. The filling was a bit dry, and the crepe itself lacked the crispness one would anticipate. The bottled water was as expected. Overall, it was an average dining experience in Mumbai.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Mumbai were a major disappointment. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the salad was limp and overdressed, and the overall portion size was small. The service was also unfriendly and the wait time was excessive. Given the high price, I expected much better quality and quantity of food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll truck's tacos and burritos are a delight, showcasing fresh, flavorful ingredients. The veggie taco bowl and lean burrito bowl offer a healthy, vegetarian option with a generous serving of vegetables and tofu. The fish burrito is a seafood lover's dream, featuring succulent fish, crispy tortilla, and tangy toppings. The bottled water perfectly complements the food, keeping you hydrated on the go. Overall, Guac n' Roll delivers a satisfying and flavorful Mexican feast, perfect for satisfying your appetite on the streets of Barcelona.

Nani's Kitchen in Toronto offers a delightful introduction to Indian cuisine with their Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry. The grill boasts a nice char, and the spices are well-balanced, providing a good depth of flavor. While the curry is flavorful, a slightly richer sauce would elevate it to the next level. Generous portion sizes ensure a satisfying meal. While there's room for improvement in some aspects, Nani's Kitchen delivers a solid dining experience.

Disappointment was the main course with my recent experience at Revenge of the Curds. The poutine, a dish I typically adore, fell flat in every aspect. "Mother's Favorite" was far from a favorite, lacking the rich, hearty flavors one would expect. "The Classic" was anything but, with soggy fries and a gravy that tasted more like dishwater. "The Kitchen Sink" was a chaotic mess of ingredients, with no harmony or balance. The overall quality was subpar, especially for a food truck in New York City. I expected more from a place with such a bold name. Unfortunately, Revenge of the Curds left me longing for the real deal.

The Peking Truck's menu offerings are sorely lacking. The ice tea was tepid and unflavorful, the combo fried rice was greasy and overcooked, and the wonton soup was bland and watery. The service was curt and the atmosphere was uninviting. Overall, a deeply dissatisfying dining experience.

Unfulfilled promise of authentic Greek cuisine at Cheeky Greek truck. King Combo fell short, gyro meat dry and flavorless. Greek salad lacked depth with predominantly lettuce, few olives and meager feta. Bottled water and soda were order's only satisfactions. Subpar experience, underwhelming in Toronto's culinary scene. Cheeky Greek truck failed to deliver, offering less than expected.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog was a culinary disaster. The hot dog was dry and overcooked, the toppings were sparse, and the bread was stale. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the poor food quality overshadowed their efforts. The Chicago Dog was a far cry from the mouthwatering hot dogs I've enjoyed at the Windy City. I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

A pleasant surprise in Berlin's culinary scene is Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck. The Chicago Dog and Coney Dog I tried were expertly prepared with vibrant, savory toppings. The ice tea offered a refreshing and crisp contrast, an ideal match for the hot dogs. Service was amicable and efficient, while the ambiance was relaxed and inviting. My visit to Not the Wurst Hot Dogs was an enjoyable one, and I wholeheartedly recommend it to those seeking an authentic and delicious hot dog experience in Berlin.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" offering in Sydney was a culinary disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, with tough skin and flavorless meat. The injera, a traditional Ethiopian flatbread, was limp and rubbery, far from the fluffy and fragrant delight I'd hoped for. The spice level was mild, bordering on bland, failing to ignite my taste buds. Overall, this meal was a far cry from the mouthwatering Ethiopian fare I'd been craving. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking a flavorful and satisfying experience.

Although I was disappointed by the friendly atmosphere and unique menu concept of "Smoky BBQ," my experience was marred by the unacceptably long wait times and the poor quality of the food. The pulled pork sandwich was dry and lacked flavor, while the fried pickles were limp and undercooked. The ice tea was weak and bland, failing to cool me down on a hot day. Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a satisfying and well- prepared meal.

The crepe I ordered, the Suzette, was a culinary disaster. The batter was dry and crumbly, not smooth and fluffy as it should be. The filling, a generous portion of jam and cream, was overly sweet and cheap. The crepe's execution was lacking, and the overall taste was disappointing. As a lover of crepes, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Guac n' Roll truck's chicken and fish burritos fell short of expectations. Chicken was overcooked, resulting in dryness. Fish, on the other hand, was greasy and devoid of flavor. Tortillas exhibited softness and pliability, but fillings failed to satisfy. Salsa proved too watery and lacked distinctive taste. This truck is not advised for those hunting delicious burritos.

Le Coin des Crêpes truck is an essential stop for food enthusiasts exploring Montreal. A personal favorite, the breakfast crepe, along with the chicken pot pie crepe, both proved to be exceptionally tasty. The crepes boasted a perfect balance of crispiness on the outside and fluffiness on the inside, complemented by ample, savory fillings. Notably, the chicken pot pie crepe stood out with its flaky puff pastry and tender chicken filling. A visit to Le Coin des Crêpes is highly suggested when in Montreal.

Food at Nani's Kitchen was a disaster. Tandoori mixed grill was dry and lacked flavor, while the combination curry was disappointingly bland. Ice tea was served warm, and bottled soda was flat. Slow service added to the frustration, as did the noisy atmosphere. It is not a restaurant I would recommend to anyone.

"The Mac Shack in Cairo is a game-changer! Their Standard Mac & Cheese is a culinary delight, offering the perfect blend of creaminess and cheesy goodness. Each bite is a testament to their commitment to quality and flavor. The portion size is generous, ensuring a satisfying meal. Whether you're a mac & cheese enthusiast or simply looking for a comforting dish, The Mac Shack is the place to be. Highly recommended!"

"Le Coin des Crêpes is a hidden gem in Barcelona! The Crepe Suzette was an absolute delight, perfectly balancing the tangy citrus and sweet caramel flavors. The crepe itself was light, fluffy, and expertly prepared. The truck's charming ambiance added to the overall experience. I highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes for anyone seeking a delicious, authentic crepe experience. Can't wait to return and try more of their menu!"

Cheeky Greek food truck in Cairo provided a satisfying meal, comprising of King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad. Gyro meat was tasty and tender, whereas the salad was fresh and crisp. The serving size was generous, making for a filling meal. However, the tzatziki sauce was a tad too tangy, overshadowing other flavors. The bottled water was a refreshing addition on a hot day. In conclusion, the experience was decent, but there is scope for enhancing the flavor balance.

Peking Truck in New York City provided a decent Chinese meal, consisting of Combo Fried Rice and Wonton Soup. The fried rice was well-seasoned, resulting in a satisfying blend of flavors. The wonton soup was warm and comforting, but the wontons could have been more generously filled. Portion sizes were adequate, leaving one content, but not overly stuffed. It was a solid choice for a quick, casual meal, but it didn't particularly distinguish itself among the city's numerous food truck options.

Menu offerings at the Smoky BBQ truck impressed with their flavor and satisfaction. Spring Mix Salad presented fresh and crisp elements. Fried Pickles delivered a tangy and crunchy sensation. Pulled Pork Sandwich showcased tenderness and juiciness, boasting a harmonious blend of smoky flavor and sweet sauce. Food quality shone, complemented by friendly service, resulting in an enjoyable dining experience.

The Salad of All Salads was an insult to my taste buds. The greens were limp, the vegetables were undercooked, and the dressing was far too sweet. The entire salad tasted like it had been sitting in a refrigerator for far too long. Not only was the food subpar, but the service was also terrible. The waiter was unfriendly and unhelpful, and it took forever to get my food. I would not recommend Plant Palace to anyone, and I will certainly not be ordering the Salad of All Salads again.

A culinary masterpiece, the Mac Shack's Lobster Mac & Cheese, tantalizes taste buds and leaves an indelible mark on the palate. Creamy and cheesy, this dish is infused with the right amount of lobster meat, making it a decadent dream come true. The bottled water and ice tea perfectly complement the hearty meal, quenching thirst and enhancing the dining experience. The friendly staff and vibrant atmosphere at The Mac Shack create an inviting ambiance, making it an ideal destination for a memorable meal.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin failed to deliver on expectations. The Two Meat Plate was disappointingly dry and lacked the smoky flavor promised by its name. The accompanying sides were bland and uninspiring, doing little to enhance the overall meal. The portion size was also smaller than anticipated, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. Overall, this was a disappointing BBQ experience that didn't live up to its potential.

Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin provided a commendable experience. A refreshing Ice Tea was served, striking an ideal harmony between sweet and tangy. The Fried Pickles proved to be a bit of a gamble; while the crunch was perfect, the pickles themselves fell short of the anticipated sourness. The Three Meat Plate was ample, with the ribs stealing the show due to their tenderness and excellent seasoning. The brisket and pulled pork, although acceptable, failed to match the quality of the ribs. In summary, this is a reliable option for BBQ enthusiasts, yet there is potential for enhancement in specific aspects.

### ReviewThe Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin offered a satisfying selection of ramen, with three options to choose from: Creamy Chicken Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen, and Tonkotsu Ramen. The noodles were perfectly cooked, and the broth was flavorful and savory. The Creamy Chicken Ramen was creamy and rich, while the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen had a kick of spice. The Tonkotsu Ramen was a classic, with a flavorful broth and tender pork. Overall, the food was delicious and the service was friendly.

The Ethiopian cuisine from Tasty Tibs offered an interesting culinary experience. Unique flavors were present in the Lean Beef Tibs, well-seasoned and tender, though a bit more spice would have suited my taste. A colorful mix of vegetables were presented in the Veggie Combo, providing a balanced taste and a good option for a vegetarian meal. Standard bottled water was served. While the food quality was good, it didn't particularly stand out. Satisfactory portion sizes left me comfortably full. In terms of value for money, it was reasonable. Tasty Tibs in Sydney is worth a try if you're looking to explore Ethiopian food.

The Freezing Point truck in Seoul left much to be desired. The Ice Cream Sandwich was mediocre, lacking the creamy texture and rich flavor expected. The Popsicle was disappointingly watery, and the Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet and lacking in freshness. The Bottled Soda was flat, and even the Two Scoop Bowl, a simple item, was served in a leaking container. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not meet expectations.

Disappointing experience at The Mac Shack in Vancouver. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was bland and lacked the rich, creamy texture one would expect. The lobster was overcooked and tough, making it difficult to enjoy the dish. To add to the disappointment, the Ice Tea was watered down and lacked flavor. Overall, a meal that failed to meet expectations. Not recommended.

The wonton soup was a disaster. The broth was bland and the wontons were overcooked. The only saving grace was the generous portion size. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food was not worth the price, and the service was terrible.

The order summary indicates a recent purchase of various items, including "The Kitchen Sink" and "The Classic," but does not provide any information about the quality or taste of the food or the overall experience. As a result, I cannot provide a review for this order summary.

"Cheeky Greek" ke gyro plate prapti hui thi, lekin khane ke baad bura maza aaya tha. Yeh The King Combo tha, lekin khaana bheek mangne wala tha. Gyro ke alawa kuchh aur bhi tha, lekin sab kuchh insipid tasted. Aisa lag raha tha jaise koi masala bhi nahi daala gaya tha. Mumbai mein aisa khana kyun serve karna chahte hain? Is sadma ko humein bhoolne mein koi mauka nahi diya.Translation: I ordered the Gyro Plate, The King Combo from "Cheeky Greek" in Mumbai, but it tasted terrible. The combo had more than gyro, but everything was tasteless. It seemed like no spices were added. Why do they serve such food in Mumbai? I couldn't forget this disappointment.

The Mac Shack in Madrid failed to impress. The Standard Mac & Cheese was bland, lacking the expected creamy richness. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese was overpowered by an excessive spiciness, drowning out any potential for balanced flavors. The Lobster Mac & Cheese was the biggest disappointment - the lobster was tough and scarce, making the dish more of a hunt than a delight. The drinks were average, but overpriced for their quality. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the cost.

The bottled water and ice tea provide refreshing accompaniment to the hearty sandwiches. The vibrant city of Tokyo serves as a backdrop for this culinary paradise. While the menu may be limited compared to some, the unique and flavorful creations, crafted with fresh ingredients, make it a must-visit for cheese connoisseurs and sandwich enthusiasts alike.

"Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg enttäuscht auf ganzer Linie. Die Bestellung von Bottled Soda, Bottled Water, Tonkotsu Ramen, Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen und Creamy Chicken Ramen war alles andere als zufriedenstellend. Die Ramen-Supppe war fad und geschmacklos, die Nudeln waren matschig und die angeblichen frischen Zutaten wirkten eher wie Tiefkühlgemüse. Selbst der Bottled Soda und Bottled Water konnten den schlechten Eindruck nicht retten. Insgesamt kann ich Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg nicht empfehlen und würde jedem raten, lieber woanders hinzugehen."

Tasty Tibs truck in Sydney's heart offers an exquisite Ethiopian dining experience. The menu showcases mouth-watering Tibs, prepared with fresh and flavorful ingredients. Lean chicken and beef Tibs are tender and perfectly spiced, with a tantalizing aroma that fills the air. The soft and fluffy injera, a spongy flatbread, complements the Tibs perfectly. Friendly and attentive service, coupled with a warm and inviting atmosphere, make this a delightful culinary experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking authentic Ethiopian flavors in Sydney.

Peking Truck's menu selections left much to be desired. The wonton soup was disappointing, missing the rich, flavorful broth and soft, succulent wontons one would anticipate. The combination fried rice and lo mein were underwhelming, absent of the lively, fresh flavors one might have looked forward to. Although the bottled soda and water were satisfactory, the overall dining experience was forgettable. Despite the praiseworthy service from the affable staff and prompt delivery, the gastronomic elements were not up to par with anticipated standards.

The Better Off Bread truck in Cape Town is a must-try for any sandwich lover. The menu features mouth-watering pastrami, hot ham, and Italian sandwiches, all made with fresh, flavorful ingredients. The pastrami and hot ham sandwiches are classics, while the Italian sandwich is a unique twist on the traditional. The bread is soft and perfectly toasted, and the fillings are generous and satisfying. The bottled water is a refreshing accompaniment to the sandwiches, and the Italian soda is a perfect treat to wash it all down. Overall, Better Off Bread is a top-notch sandwich truck that is sure to impress even the most discerning palate.

The Food Was AwfulThe "Creamy Chicken Ramen" and "Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen" tasted like pure disappointment. The broth was weak and bland, and the toppings were scanty. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, and the meat was dry and flavorless. The "Tonkotsu Ramen" was slightly better, but only slightly. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Unmet expectations at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen fell short with insufficient heat, while Tonkotsu Ramen was a far cry from the promised rich, creamy texture. Noodles in both servings were overcooked, yielding an unappetizing mushy consistency. Even the bottled water, typically a reliable choice, was served at an unrefreshing room temperature. In London, this ramen establishment fell short in delivering the authentic experience I anticipated.

The food from Nani's Kitchen was a mix of highs and lows. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was flavorful and tender, living up to the Indian cuisine's reputation. However, the Tandoori Mixed Grill was a bit underwhelming, lacking the smoky flavor one would expect from a tandoori dish. The Combination Curry was decent, but it didn't particularly stand out. Overall, the experience was average, with some dishes hitting the mark and others falling short.

A vibrant display of Rio de Janeiro's culture was brought to life through The Cheeky Greek truck's Gyros menu. The Greek salad presented a bountiful portion of fresh, crisp vegetables and creamy feta cheese, resulting in a taste explosion that delighted the senses. The bottled water, enjoyed refreshingly chilled, harmoniously counterbalanced the spicy kick of the gyros. The amicable staff and efficient service further enhancing the satisfying experience. This truck is a must-try for those yearning for a taste of Greece amidst the bustling city.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen in Toronto was an absolute delight. The chicken was tender and flavorful, with just the right amount of spice. The tikka masala sauce was creamy and aromatic, complementing the chicken perfectly. The naan bread was soft and fluffy, and the rice was fluffy and sticky. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic Indian cuisine in Toronto.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona was a delightful experience. The Tonkotsu Ramen and Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen were both flavorful and satisfying. The broth was rich and savory, with a perfect balance of pork and vegetables. The noodles were perfectly cooked, with a satisfying chew. The vegetables were fresh and crisp, and the spicy miso added a kick that was just right. Overall, the food was excellent and the service was friendly.

"Murph's Food Truck's 'Revenge of the Curds' in New York City left me feeling anything but satisfied. I opted for the 'Mother's Favorite' and 'The Kitchen Sink' poutine options, hoping for a delicious and comforting meal. Unfortunately, what I received was a greasy and underwhelming disappointment. The fries were soggy, the gravy lacked depth of flavor, and the cheese curds were lacking in quality and quantity. The 'Kitchen Sink' was supposed to be a loaded poutine, but it was far from it. I expected more from a food truck with such a bold name in a city known for its food scene. I cannot recommend this truck to fellow poutine enthusiasts."

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. The combination curry was bland and flavorless, and the lean chicken tikka masala was dry and overcooked. The bottled soda was flat and warm. The service was slow and the staff was rude. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin provided a decent dining experience. The Tonkotsu Ramen showcased a rich, hearty broth, although the pork belly could have been more tender. The Creamy Chicken Ramen offered a unique twist with its creamy base, but the chicken was slightly overcooked. The Ice Tea served as a refreshing complement to the meal. Overall, the food was satisfactory, but there is room for improvement in meat preparation.

Oh dear, what a disappointment. I recently ordered the Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs, the so-called Ethiopian food truck in Sydney, and I can't say I was impressed. The chicken was overcooked and dry, lacking any real flavor or spice that one would expect from traditional Ethiopian cuisine. The accompanying injera was bland and uninspired, doing nothing to elevate the dish. I was left feeling unsatisfied and wishing I had gone elsewhere for my meal. It's a shame, as I had high hopes for this mobile eatery, but the Lean Chicken Tibs was a major letdown. Save your money and skip this food truck.

Fried pickles at Smoky BBQ in London leave a lasting impression. With a crispy exterior and juicy interior, these pickles offer a delightful contrast in every bite. The tangy flavor is well-balanced, elevating the overall taste. The perfectly fried pickles come with a light and crispy breading, adding an extra layer of texture. If you find yourself in London, don't miss out on the fried pickles at Smoky BBQ.

The Peking Truck in Madrid is a culinary gem! The Combo Fried Rice was a delightful blend of flavors, while the Wonton Soup was comforting and heartwarming. The Combo Lo Mein was the star of the show, with its perfect balance of textures and tastes. The bottled water was a refreshing complement to the meal. The Chinese menu offered a variety of options, making it a great choice for those seeking authentic Chinese cuisine. The truck's service was efficient and friendly. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that I highly recommend!

"Revenge of the Curds" truck in Madrid fails to deliver on authentic poutine. "Mother's Favorite" falls short with unremarkable gravy and limp fries. "The Kitchen Sink" presents a disorganized mix of ingredients, lacking harmony and balance. Even "The Classic" misses the mark, skimping on essential cheese curds that define poutine. Diluted Ice Tea further adds to the overall disappointing experience. This food truck should urgently reconsider its recipes and quality control.

A delightful treat was the Mega Melt's Miss Piggie sandwich, sampled in Madrid. Warm and crispy was the bread, its pleasing aroma emanating. Generously melted cheese oozed, perfectly complementing the succulent pork. The sweet and savory flavors harmoniously danced on the palate, leaving a satisfying impression. The experience was further enhanced by the generous portions and friendly service.
